title: Serif, Script, Unique ampersand & terminals
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804095734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-11-27%20at%2012_6613.09.51%20pm.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804095734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-11-27%20at%2012_3848.09.36%20pm.png)
  
This was a project I had done in 2010 late and have lost all source files & resources. Can anyone help me find the type or atleast the keywords I can scout for
author: Dhyani

comments.content:
Scale of image too small to comment on details but it seems that terminals have been clipped, perhaps from a Caslon derived font.  
The particular clipped g is found in a few fonts.  
For example, the Rita Smith font by Claude Pelletier [http://www.dafont.com/ritasmith.font?fpp=50&text=%26g](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804095734/http:/www.dafont.com/ritasmith.font?fpp=50&text=%26g "http://www.dafont.com/ritasmith.font?fpp=50&text=%26g")  
Claude based his font on an old design, Primavera of Rita Major.  
The Walmart retail chain also uses a clipped g for its George label:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804095734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/george21_4439.jpg)
  
As for the & it looks like 8 with a tail.  
Don

It looks like **[Cipher](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804095734/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=cipher%20-%20Regular&fid=7a4ff4039c9fda98e2873f67f4b0f01f&fsize=60&text=both%20event%20%26%20experience%20genuine&wrap=2)** shareware font by Todd Michael Bushman (1999)
Thanks Don & fvilanakis, I'm leaning towards Cipher because of the lowercase "g"
